My past experiences have made me the person I am today. Doing time in the joint wasn't easy, but it taught me how to survive. For me, that meant learning how to steal, how to scam, and how to talk my way out of sticky situations.

They look at you like you're dirt, like you're less than human. They don't care that you've done your time, that you're trying to turn your life around. All they see is the label: "ex-con."
